options: Your unique professional identity and reputation - what people say about you when you're not in the room
questions.explanation: Personal brand is your reputation: what you're known for, how you're perceived, the value you represent. Jeff Bezos: 'Your brand is what people say about you when you're not in the room.' Elements: expertise, values, personality, visual identity, content, consistency. Everyone has a brand; successful people build theirs intentionally.

options: Establishing expertise by consistently sharing valuable insights and innovative ideas in your field
questions.explanation: Thought leaders are recognized experts who shape conversations in their industry. Build thought leadership by: (1) Publishing valuable content (articles, books, videos), (2) Speaking at events, (3) Sharing original insights/research, (4) Taking positions on industry issues, (5) Being quoted in media. Thought leadership attracts opportunities, clients, and partnerships.

questions.text: What is the best content strategy for building authority?
options: Focus on one niche, consistently share valuable insights that solve audience problems, demonstrate expertise
questions.explanation: Authority-building content: (1) Pick specific niche - be known for ONE thing first, (2) Solve real problems your audience faces, (3) Share knowledge freely - teach, don't sell, (4) Be consistent - daily/weekly presence, (5) Tell stories - make ideas memorable, (6) Document journey - authenticity builds trust. The 80/20 rule: 80% value, 20% promotion.

questions.text: What is LinkedIn's purpose in personal branding?
options: Professional platform for demonstrating expertise, building network, and attracting opportunities
questions.explanation: LinkedIn is the #1 platform for professional branding. Use it to: (1) Optimize profile for keywords, (2) Share valuable content regularly, (3) Engage meaningfully with others' content, (4) Build authority in your niche, (5) Make strategic connections. Posting 3-5x weekly with valuable insights positions you as authority and attracts opportunities passively.
